docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: THE mice, light brown females of a common laboratory variety, look ordinary. But they carry a trait that sets them apart from all other mice on earth: they produce milk that contains a human blood substance valuable in treating heart attacks.

headline.main: Gene-Altered Animals Enter a Commercial Era

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The nation's state and Federal prison systems, already straining as they handle more and more prisonerssentenced to longer and longer terms, are beginning to confront a complicated and costly new problem: elderly convicts.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES, DEPARTMENT OF

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: As many as one in seven elderly medical patients suffers from severe depression in addition to physical illness, a new study has found. And in many cases, or perhaps most, the depression goes undiagnosed and untreated, frequently worsening or complicating the physical disorder.

headline.main: Depression Among Elderly Patients Is Often Undetected, Study Finds
